enWisdom: NULL
Obligation is the corruptor of good actions
Obligation spoils the favour
Obligation corrupts the good act
Obligation corrupts the favour
A benevolent act is sullied by repeatedly putting one under obligation through it
Delay and obligation are the spoilers of [the] favour [one does to others]

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْمَنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ فَإِنَّ الِامْتِنَانَ يُكَدِّرُ الْإِحْسَانَ
enWisdom: Beware of putting obligations with your good acts for indeed [putting others under] obligation spoils favours
Through obligation the favour is spoilt
By putting a lot of obligation, the good action is spoilt
The completion of benevolence is abandoning [putting one under] obligation by it

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّوَالِ مَا تَقَدَّمَهُ الْمَطَلُ وَتَعَقَّبَهُ الْمَنُّ
enWisdom: The worst grant is that which is preceded by delay and followed by obligation
The worst of the benevolent ones is the one who puts others under obligation by his favour
Prolonged obligation spoils the pureness of a good turn
The oppression of favours is [through] the repulsiveness of [putting others under] obligation
One who puts an obligation [on others] by his good action has oppressed magnanimity
Too much obligation spoils the good action

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مِنَ الْكَرَمِ تَنْكِيدُ الْمِنَنِ بِالْمَنِّ
enWisdom: It is not from munificence to spoil the favours [one does to others] by [putting them under] obligation
One who puts others under obligation for his favour, spoils it
One who puts an obligation [on others] with his kind act drops [and forgoes] his gratitude

Wisdom: مَنْ مَنَّ بِمَعْرُوفِهِ فَقَدْ كَدَّرَ مَا صَنَعَهُ
enWisdom: One who puts obligation with his goodness has spoilt the good act that he has done

Wisdom: مَنْ مَنَّ بِإِحْسَانِهِ فَكَأَنَّهُ لَمْ يُحْسِنْ
enWisdom: Whoever puts an obligation with his favour, it is as if he has not done a favour
One who puts obligation with his good action corrupts it

Wisdom: مِنْ فَضْلِ الرَّجُلِ أَنْ لَا يَمُنَّ بِمَا احْتَمَلَهُ حِلْمُهُ
enWisdom: It is from the merit of a man not to put the one whom he has been forbearing with under obligation
Nothing spoils good actions like putting [others under] obligation

Wisdom: مَا أَهْنَأَ الْعَطَاءَ مَنْ مَنَّ بِهِ
enWisdom: He who puts an obligation [on others] has not made his grant pleasing

Wisdom: مَا هَنَأَ بِمَعْرُوفِهِ مَنْ كَثُرَ امْتِنَانُهُ
enWisdom: He who puts [others under] a lot of obligation has not made his good turn felicitous

Wisdom: مَا أَكْمَلَ الْمَعْرُوفَ مَنْ مَنَّ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who puts [others under] obligation with his good act has not perfected it
The basis of goodness is abandoning obligation through it
The sin of the charity given by the one who puts obligation is greater than its reward

Wisdom: لَا تَرْجُوَنَّ فَضْلَ مَنَّانٍ وَلَا تَأْتَمِنِ الْأَحْمَقَ وَالْخَوَّانَ
enWisdom: Never have hope in the favour of one who makes you feel obliged, and do not rely upon the fool and the traitor
One who puts [others under] obligation does no good to others
There is no good deed with obligation
There is no virtue in the good turn that is reckoned [as a favour]
There is no pleasure in the good turn of the obliger

Wisdom: لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ خَبٌّ وَلَا مَنَّانٌ
enWisdom: Neither a swindler nor one who put others under obligation, will enter Paradise
There is no evil quality more repulsive than [putting others under] obligation

Wisdom: يَا أَهْلَ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَالْإِحْسَانِ لَا تَمُنُّوا بِإِحْسَانِكُمْ فَإِنَّ الْإِحْسَانَ وَالْمَعْرُوفَ يُبْطِلُهُ قُبْحُ الِامْتِنَانِ
enWisdom: people of goodness and beneficence, do not put [others under] obligation with your favours for indeed favours and good turns are nullified by the repulsiveness of [putting others under] obligations

Wisdom: أَصْلِحْ إِذَا أَنْتَ أَفْسَدْتَ وَأَتْمِمْ إِذَا أَنْتَ أَحْسَنْتَ
enWisdom: Rectify when you have corrupted and complete [your good act] when you have done good

Wisdom: أَشَدُّ النَّاسِ عُقُوبَةً رَجُلٌ كَافَأَ الْإِحْسَانَ بِالْإِسَاءَةِ
enWisdom: The most severely punished of all people is one who recompenses good with evil
When you do a good turn [to someone], forget it
When a good turn is done to you, recall it
The beauty of benevolence is [in] relinquishing obligation
Nurturing a good turn is better than starting it

Wisdom: سَلِ الْمَعْرُوفَ مَنْ يَنْسَاهُ وَاصْطَنِعْهُ إِلَى مَنْ يَذْكُرُهُ
enWisdom: Ask for good from one who forgets it and do good to the one who recalls it
Sometimes it is better to give in order to fulfil a promise [and not delay it]
How many a person is gradually drawn to his destruction through the good that is done to him
Recompense is liberation

Wisdom: مَنْ هَمَّ أَنْ يُكَافِيَ عَلَى الْمَعْرُوفِ [وَ عَجَزَ] فَقَدْ كَافَى [كَافَأَ]
enWisdom: One who endeavours to recompense the good that is done to him has indeed recompensed it

Wisdom: مَنْ شَكَرَ إِلَيْكَ مَعْرُوفَكَ فَقَدْ سَأَلَكَ
enWisdom: One who shows gratitude to you for your kindness (or the kindness of someone else) has [actually] requested you [for something]
One of the signs of nobleness is hastening in [giving] reward
From the signs of being forsaken by Allah is considering that which is evil as something good

Wisdom: مِنْ سَعَادَةِ الْمَرْءِ أَنْ تَكُونَ صَنَائِعُهُ عِنْدَ مَنْ يَشْكُرُهُ وَمَعْرُوفُهُ عِنْدَ مَنْ لَا يَكْفُرُهُ
enWisdom: It is from the felicity of a person that his good turns are done to one who thanks him and his benevolence is shown to one who is not ungrateful to him

Wisdom: لَا تُسِئْ إِلَى مَنْ أَحْسَنَ إِلَيْكَ فَمَنْ أَسَاءَ إِلَى مَنْ أَحْسَنَ إِلَيْهِ مُنِعَ الْإِحْسَانَ
enWisdom: Extend your hand in recompense to the one who has done good to you, and if you are unable [to do this] then the very least you should do is thank him

Wisdom: لَا تَزْكُو إِلَّا عِنْدَ الْكِرَامِ الصَّنَائِعُ
enWisdom: Good turns do not thrive except with the honourable

Wisdom: لَا يَسْتَقِيمُ قَضَاءُ الْحَوَائِجِ إِلَّا بِثَلَاثٍ بِتَصْغِيرِهَا لِتَعْظُمَ وَسَتْرِهَا لِتَظْهَرَ وَتَعْجِيلِهَا لِتَهْنَأَ
enWisdom: The fulfilling of needs is not made righteous except by three things: by considering it to be small such that it becomes great, by hiding it such that it is made apparent [by Allah] and by expediting it such that it becomes felicitous
